data.title: Business Immigration
data.summary: Business immigration services - Start-Up Visa, PNP Entrepreneur, C11, Self-Employed

hero.title: Business Immigration
hero.subtitle: Empowering Entrepreneurs, Investors & Self-Employed Professionals to Launch and Grow in Canada
hero.body: At TENTACULAR IMMIGRATION SOLUTIONS LTD, we guide ambitious business-minded individuals through Canada's federal and provincial business immigration streams - helping you transition from startup idea to permanent residency, legally and strategically.

programsIntro.title: Business Immigration Pathways
programsIntro.subtitle: Choose the right pathway for your business goals and immigration objectives

programs.title: Start-Up Visa Program
programs.subtitle: For visionary entrepreneurs with innovative business ideas
programs.description: Canada's Start-Up Visa Program is designed for visionary entrepreneurs who have the potential to build innovative businesses in Canada that can compete globally, create jobs for Canadians, and drive long-term economic growth.

requirements.listItem: Letter of Support from a designated organization

programs.title: Provincial Entrepreneur Streams
programs.subtitle: Tailored pathways for regional business builders
programs.description: Each province offers entrepreneur streams under the PNP, providing permanent residence pathways to qualified businesspeople ready to invest, settle, and contribute to the local economy.

programs.title: C11 Work Permit
programs.subtitle: Launch or acquire a Canadian business without LMIA
programs.description: The C11 work permit allows entrepreneurs to enter Canada to actively manage their own business, owning at least 50% and demonstrating significant economic benefit to the country.

requirements.listItem: Own at least 50% of a Canadian business

programs.title: Self-Employed Persons Program
programs.subtitle: For cultural professionals, athletes, and artists
programs.description: Direct pathway to permanent residency for individuals with relevant experience in cultural or athletic activities who intend to continue working independently in Canada.

requirements.listItem: Two or more years of self-employment experience
Intent to be self-employed in Canada

startupVisaIntro.title: Start-Up Visa Program
startupVisaIntro.subtitle: Launch your innovative business in Canada with a permanent residency pathway

startupVisaHowItWorks.heading: How It Works
startupVisaHowItWorks.description: To qualify for the Start-Up Visa, you must:

howItWorks.heading: Secure Designated Support
howItWorks.text: Submit your business idea to a designated incubator, angel investor group, or venture capital fund. If approved, you will receive the required Letter of Support.

howItWorks.heading: Meet Language Benchmarks
howItWorks.text: Achieve at least CLB 5 in English or French.

howItWorks.heading: Show Settlement Funds
howItWorks.text: Demonstrate that you can support yourself and your dependents in Canada according to IRCC guidelines.

howItWorks.heading: Launch While You Wait
howItWorks.text: Apply for a temporary work permit to begin operating in Canada while your permanent residence application is processed.

startupVisaServicesCopy.heading: Our Start-Up Visa Services
startupVisaServicesCopy.description: High-touch guidance from idea validation to landing in Canada.

seServices.title: Pitch and Innovation Coaching
seServices.description: Refine your business model and pitch package for designated organizations.

seServices.title: Letter of Support Assembly
seServices.description: Coordinate applications and due diligence packages for incubators, angels, or venture capital funds.

seServices.title: Founder Alignment
seServices.description: Align roles, equity, and relocation plans across your founding team.

seServices.title: Work Permit Launch Plan
seServices.description: Prepare LMIA-exempt work permits so you can start operating in Canada.

startupVisaFeesCopy.heading: Start-Up Visa Program: Understanding the Fees
startupVisaFeesCopy.description: Plan for private market fees alongside your business launch budget.

fees.description: For entrepreneurs joining existing startup groups
fees.note: Private-market fees, not charged by IRCC

fees.description: Business incubators, angel investors, or venture capital funds
fees.note: Varies based on business stage and potential

fees.description: Funding the actual launch of your startup

startupVisaGovFeesCopy.heading: IRCC and Government Fees
startupVisaGovFeesCopy.description: Standard federal fees charged for permanent residence applications.

quoteCTA.heading: Start-Up Visa - Request a Quote
quoteCTA.body: Canada's Start-Up Visa Program offers permanent residence to entrepreneurs with innovative business ideas that can create jobs for Canadians. Tell us about your concept and we will map the next steps.
quoteCTA.footnote: Email us at info@tentacularimmigration.com with "Canada Start-Up Visa" in the subject line.

provincialIntro.title: Provincial Entrepreneur & Investor Streams
provincialIntro.subtitle: Tailored immigration pathways for regional business builders

provincialOverview.heading: Program Overview
provincialOverview.description: Each province or territory has its own entrepreneur stream under the Provincial Nominee Program, offering permanent residence pathways to qualified businesspeople who invest, settle, and contribute to the local economy.

c11Intro.title: C11 Work Permit
c11Intro.subtitle: Launch or acquire a Canadian business and work without an LMIA

c11Overview.heading: Program Overview
c11Overview.description: The C11 work permit is an LMIA-exempt pathway for entrepreneurs and business owners who want to enter Canada to actively manage their own business. It is designed for individuals who own at least 50 percent of a Canadian business and can demonstrate a significant economic benefit to the country.

c11Highlights.title: 50 Percent Ownership
c11Highlights.description: Minimum ownership requirement in the Canadian business.

c11Highlights.title: Active Management
c11Highlights.description: Hands-on involvement in day-to-day business operations.

c11Highlights.title: Economic Benefit
c11Highlights.description: Show measurable benefit such as jobs, innovation, or regional growth.

c11Timeline.title: Extension
c11Timeline.description: Possible when business operations continue to show benefit.

c11Timeline.title: PR Pathway
c11Timeline.description: Accessible after establishing the business and gaining Canadian experience.

c11Benefits.title: Create or maintain jobs for Canadians
c11Benefits.description: Demonstrate employment opportunities for the local workforce.

c11Benefits.title: Introduce innovative goods or services
c11Benefits.description: Bring new technologies or solutions to the Canadian market.

c11Benefits.title: Expand regional economic opportunities
c11Benefits.description: Contribute to local economic development and growth.

c11Benefits.title: Increase exports or international markets
c11Benefits.description: Help Canada expand its global trade relationships.

selfEmployedIntro.title: Self-Employed Persons Program
selfEmployedIntro.subtitle: For cultural professionals, athletes, and artists seeking permanent residence in Canada

items.listItem: Dancers, artisans, designers, and other cultural contributors
Have at least two years of relevant self-employment or world-class participation
Intend and be able to become self-employed in Canada
Score well under the federal selection grid
Meet language, medical, security, and financial requirements

selfEmployedServicesCopy.heading: How We Help
selfEmployedServicesCopy.description: Showcase your cultural or athletic track record with a compliant submission.

selfEmployedServices.title: Narrative Building
selfEmployedServices.description: Highlight past contributions and Canadian plans.

selfEmployedServices.title: Document Preparation
selfEmployedServices.description: Organize proof of self-employment and achievements.

selfEmployedServices.title: Full Representation
selfEmployedServices.description: Guidance through every stage of the application process.

postInvestmentIntro.title: Post-Investment Permanent Residency
postInvestmentIntro.subtitle: PR eligibility follows successful business establishment for most federal and PNP pathways

postInvestmentCards.title: Continuous Business Ownership
postInvestmentCards.description: Maintain active ownership or management of your Canadian business.

postInvestmentCards.title: Job Creation for Canadians
postInvestmentCards.description: Demonstrate employment opportunities created for Canadian workers.

postInvestmentCards.title: Program Compliance
postInvestmentCards.description: Stay aligned with program rules and performance agreements.

postInvestmentSupport.title: Our PR Application Support
postInvestmentSupport.description: We support your permanent residence application with document preparation, compliance checks, and submission timing so you can transition smoothly to PR status.

finalCta.title: Ready to Scale Your Business in Canada?
finalCta.body: Let's map your path whether you are looking to launch a startup, invest, or self-employ. We help you turn your Canadian business plans into reality.
finalCta.footnote: Start smart. Start strong. Start with TENTACULAR IMMIGRATION SOLUTIONS LTD.
